value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a broadsheet at the, in <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-chea" key="Cheapside">Cheapside</rs>; <del>a</del> <del>and</del> but you can see <del>at [illeg.]</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the author: <del>And</del> & anonymity has become the cloak worn</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">by those who wish to conceal. <del>Not</del> The old <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">had nothing to conceal; <del>his audience was</del> <del>But</del> <del>It for his audience</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the audience was so little interested in him <add place="above">his name</add> that</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <del>adoption of a name was</del> he never thought to give it.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The voice that broke <del>that silence was</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& the voice that sang was like a birds voice.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was the voice of Anon singing out of doors.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Some one must have heard the song & noted it,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for it was remembered, & later written down.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The singer had his audience, but the audience was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so little interested in his name that he</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">never thought to give it. The audience</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">took part in the song. [illeg.]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">they sang <del>or [claphed?], or</del> filling in the [illeg.];</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">helping out the meaning</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The <del>author singer had no house, no name;</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anon is only a voice; without <del>home, with</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sex, <del>without lodging</del><add place="inline">|</add> He sings because the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">spring has come, & winter is gone; because he loves</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">because he is hungry; or thirsty; or merry.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">His songs are rough; but remembered because they</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>bear</del> everybody shares the emotion <add>& knows the story.</add> <del>the love of</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Love; <del>& fear, [depth?] & laughter are</del> <del>original</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>pure</del> <del>emotions the</del> Anon therefore is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">common singer; the undifferentiated. <del>He is</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sometimes woman; sometimes man. <del>We can</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>see him going</del> <del>never indoors</del>, along out of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">doors; seeing, <del>the if</del> <del>the</del> Anon is</l>
